div.p: George Leo Callewaert. 10.VIII.1942. 11.IX.2006. Vir sagax benevolusque.

This twenty-first century gravestone lists the names of one person, George Leo Callewaert. The dating on this grave is interesting for two reasons. The first is that is certainly the only grave in this collection, and possibly the only gravestone in the churchyard, which uses the short form of dating, giving the number of the month. The second interesting point is that this month is given as a Roman numeral, mixing Roman numerals and Arabic numbers in the dating. From the date of birth and date of death, we can however calculate that George died at the age of 64. This is also the only gravestone in this collection to use a language other than English, using a sentence of Latin here, which can be translated to mean 'A wise and benevolent man'. This gravestone is located in a separate section at the back of the churchyard, named the vineyard (Plot number 122), which contains mainly graves from the late twentieth or twenty-first century, as well as memorial benches, memorial stones, and a war memorial.
